thread.title: The Voice UK viewers left 'confused' after will.i.am gives out his email to rejected contestant | Metro News
thread.title_full: The Voice UK viewers left 'confused' after will.i.am gives out his email to rejected contestant | Metro News

author: Adam Starkey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: The Voice UK viewers left 'confused' after will.i.am gives out his email to rejected contestant | Metro News
text:
Adam Starkey for Metro.co.uk Sunday 26 Feb 2017 9:42 am Will.i.am offered his email to Charlie Drew (Picture: ITV) 
Will.i.am appears to have adopted a sneaky tactic for dodging ‘steal’ commitments on The Voice UK, by offering contestants his personal email address instead. Here’s what to expect from The Voice UK’s battle rounds 
The 41-year-old Voice UK judge caused a stir on last night’s show (February 25), after offering contestant Charlie Drew his email address after losing out to Dannii Barnes in the battle rounds. 
Following the round, Charlie begged the judges for a steal, saying: ‘I just don’t feel like I’m ready to go. I think I’ve got a lot more to provide.’ To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Sir Tom Jones agreed, saying: ‘I think that somebody should definitely steal you, honestly.’ 
After the red lights of rejection beamed in the studio however, will.i.am approached Charlie and said: ‘Here’s my email. Let’s connect.’ 
Potential record contract? Guest vocalist appearance? Running low on party guests? Who knows. Will.i.am has been covering his face during tense ‘steal’ segments (Picture: ITV) 
Following the exchange, he added: ‘What I like about Charlie from the blinds is that his voice was flawless. I just had my eye out on a certain person, and each one of us has only one person to steal.’
